dt: {bc}the coat of wool covering a wool-bearing animal (such as a sheep)
{bc}the wool obtained from a sheep at one shearing
{bc}any of various soft or woolly coverings
{bc}a soft bulky deep-piled knitted or woven fabric used chiefly for clothing

et: Middle English {it}flees{/it}, from Old English {it}flēos{/it}; akin to Middle High German {it}vlius{/it} fleece and perhaps to Latin {it}pluma{/it} feather, down
shortdef: the coat of wool covering a wool-bearing animal (such as a sheep)
the wool obtained from a sheep at one shearing
any of various soft or woolly coverings

dt: {bc}to strip of money or property by fraud or extortion
{bc}to charge excessively for goods or services

shortdef: to strip of money or property by fraud or extortion
to charge excessively for goods or services
to remove the fleece from : shear

dt: {bc}a fleece of gold placed by the king of Colchis in a dragon-guarded grove and recovered by the Argonauts

shortdef: a fleece of gold placed by the king of Colchis in a dragon-guarded grove and recovered by the Argonauts
